meanings.definition: The state or condition of being impossible.
meanings.sent1: The teacher explained the concept of impossibilities to the students.
meanings.sent2: Believing in magic is one of the impossibilities of childhood.
meanings.sent3: The idea of a cat driving a car is one of the impossibilities that make us smile.
meanings.sent4: In a world of possibilities, impossibilities can sometimes spark creativity.
meanings.sent5: The weightless feeling of dreaming defies the heaviness of impossibilities.

meanings.definition: Things that are impossible to achieve or happen.
meanings.sent1: The list of impossibilities included flying without wings.
meanings.sent2: Overcoming all impossibilities requires determination and perseverance.
meanings.sent3: Trying to lick your elbow is one of those funny impossibilities.
meanings.sent4: Her laughter echoed through the room, breaking the silence of impossibilities.
meanings.sent5: The mountain stood tall, a symbol of nature's own impossibilities.
